page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN DEWSBURY
page.content: A ring road is presently being built by-passing Dewsbury, thus diverting traffic from the town centre.The cost of the project is Â£3.5 million for 1.5 miles of road. There are 5 major roads leading into Dewsbury and a traffic count was done on the Wakefield and Leeds Roads aiming to discover the average flow of cars and lorries into and out of Dewsbury.On Wakefield Road cars going into and leaving Dewsbury averaged about 300 per hour. On Leeds Road there were fewer cars per hour- 218 and 234 respectively.Wakefield Road had 106 lorries per hour into Dewsbury and 80 per hour leaving.On Leeds Road the numbers were 24 and 54 per hour respectively.There is a British Rail station in Dewsbury on the trans Pennine Liverpool to Newcastle route with an hourly service each way, plus local trains.
